author: ragnaroktomorrow

text: Both Shenmue games have fantastic soundtracks but if you mean the games themselves then yes it is. The first game is very slow paced and takes a while to get to the good parts and you can't skip time. You can in Shenmue 2 and the areas to explore are huge and more detailed and the pacing is better. But unless you're a pretty patient player then Shenmue probably isn't a good game series for you. Otherwise you'll probably like it quite a bit; 2 is my favourite game. Hope that helps :)

author: Raul

text: Haven't gone to Japan yet (will be in a few years, super excited) but have lived in Kowloon City, Hong Kong a short time as a very young child about 20 years ago. The roasted chestnuts in the morning, the double-decker buses, the Bruce Lee toys, the ferry rides, Ocean Park, Lion Rock, and the warm people. I miss it dearly; one of the most beautiful places in the world. And this track ain't helping one bit, Supra. Heh, I urge you, no IMPLORE you to visit Hong Kong at least once in your life.

author: Daniel Cardoso

text: It was more than just playing a video game for me, Shenmue 1&2 provided me with an unforgettable﻿ experience. It felt like I was traveling to Japan and Hong Kong and it's one of the big reasons I really want to go there someday. If I could ask for any single sequel to be created, it'd be Shenmue III.
author: SupraDarky

text: This theme is a masterpiece, just like the series. Honestly, I can't separate Shenmue 1 and 2, they're both tied. I probably have more nostalgia for the 1st (played it around Christmas while it was snowing out my window) but Shenmue II is longer and more polished. Shenmue 1&2 didn't age too well because of the tank controls and the graphics not being mind blowing anymore (they definitely were back then). However the story, the audiovisual presentation and the atmosphere is﻿ still among the best.
author: SupraDarky
